Body.Description:
Response parser framework supports extraction of required values from API/device responses. These responses may be of various content types such as XML, JSON, etc. The values of importance are modeled as parameters in the response parser framework.
The parameters can be of a scalar value type or a collection of values. A group of related parameters can be modeled as a single complex type parameter. These complex types will be very useful to extract a set of repeating group of related parameters.
A response parser specification defines the set of parameters that need to be extracted from the content. The response parser specification allows complex type definitions to be defined for any complex parameters.
Body.Label: Response Parser
Body.Name: ResponseParserType

TypeDefinition.Description: The collection of parameters that need to be extracted from the API response.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parameters
TypeDefinition.Name: Parameters

Body.Description: Invokes the given Web API against the given endpoint. The endpoint can be Intersight API or an external endpoint added as Target in Intersight. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked.
Body.Label: Invoke Web API Request
Body.Name: InvokeGenericWebApi

InputDefinition.Description: The API call can be made to Intersight or an external endpoint added as Target. Target should be in claimed or connected state. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked. An empty value for this input indicates that the API call is made to Intersight.
InputDefinition.Label: External Target
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Properties.Selector: /api/v1/asset/Targets?$filter=((TargetType eq HTTPEndpoint and Status eq Claimed) or ((TargetType eq PureStorageFlashArray or TargetType eq HitachiVirtualStoragePlatform or TargetType eq NetAppActiveIqUnifiedManager or TargetType eq TerraformCloud or TargetType eq VmwareVcenter or TargetType eq APIC) and Status eq Connected))

InputDefinition.Description: HTTP protocol to be used - HTTP, HTTPS. Populated implicitly by fetching the value from target task input if API endpoint is added as target within Intersight. Default value of HTTPS is set if not specified in other scenarios.
InputDefinition.Label: Protocol
InputDefinition.Name: Protocol

InputDefinition.Description: HTTP method to be requested on the given URL. If the value is not given, GET is used as default.
InputDefinition.Label: Method
InputDefinition.Name: Method

InputDefinition.Description: Relative URL for Intersight, Device Registration and Target APIs. Does not support specifying fully qualified URL.
InputDefinition.Label: URL
InputDefinition.Name: Url

InputDefinition.Description: The request headers that need to be sent in the request in key value pairs list.
InputDefinition.Label: Headers
InputDefinition.Name: Headers

InputDefinition.Description: The key value pairs given in this input will be sent in HTTP 'Cookie' header.
InputDefinition.Label: Cookies
InputDefinition.Name: Cookies

InputDefinition.Description: The type of the response. Currently supports JSON.
InputDefinition.Label: Response Type
InputDefinition.Name: ContentType

InputDefinition.Description: The optional request body that is sent as part of this API request. The request body can contain golang templates that can be populated with task input parameters and previous API output parameters.
InputDefinition.Label: Body
InputDefinition.Name: Body

InputDefinition.Description: The structure of the response parser shall provide the list of values that need to be extracted from the API response.
InputDefinition.Label: Response Parser
InputDefinition.Name: ResponseParser

InputDefinition.Description:
Allows to capture the possible outcomes of this API. This is a collection of outcomes which gets evaluated in the order they are given. If an outcome condition evaluates to 'true', status of the task can be set to one of the supported types - Success, Error or no operation and also an optional task execution message can be set.
At the end of the outcomes list, a catchall success/fail outcome can be added with condition explicitly set as 'true'. This allows to mark the status of task execution either success or failure when none of the previous outcomes match.
When no outcomes is specified, default behaviour is to mark the API execution status 'success' if obtained HTTP status code is 2xx else mark it as 'failed'.
InputDefinition.Label: Outcomes
InputDefinition.Name: Outcomes

OutputDefinition.Description: The response headers that are extracted from the API response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Headers
OutputDefinition.Name: Headers

OutputDefinition.Description: The list of cookies obtained from the response in the form of key value pairs.
OutputDefinition.Label: Cookies
OutputDefinition.Name: Cookies

OutputDefinition.Description: The HTTP status code of the Web API response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Status Code
OutputDefinition.Name: StatusCode

OutputDefinition.Description: The HTTP status message of the Web API response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Status Message
OutputDefinition.Name: StatusMessage

OutputDefinition.Description: The list of output parameters extracted from the response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Parameters
OutputDefinition.Name: Parameters

Outcomes.Message: The "{{.global.task.input.TerraformOrganizationName}} / {{.global.task.input.TerraformWorkspaceName}}" Terraform Organisation Workspace names are not in the system. Try again by providing the right names.
We are unable to fetch the Workspace details due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{.global.GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails.output.HttpStatusMsg}}."
The Workspace ID in use is "{{.global.GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails.output.WorkspaceId}}".
We are unable to fetch the name of agent with ID "{{.global.GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails.output.AgentPoolId}}".
Outcomes.Name: FetchingAgentPoolNameFailure

Outcomes.Message: The Workspace ID in use is "{{.global.GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails.output.WorkspaceId}}" and the agent pool in use is "{{index .global.GetAgentPoolName.output.AgentPoolName 0}}".
Outcomes.Name: FetchingAgentPoolNameSuccess

Body.Description: API Task to fetch workspace Id
Body.Name: GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails

Output.ApplyMethod: {{ if eq .global.GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails.output.WorkspaceAutoApply true }} Auto apply {{else}} Manual apply {{end}}
Output.UserInterface: {{ if eq .global.GetTerraformWorkspaceDetails.output.UserInterface true }} Structured Run Output {{else}} Console UI {{end}}

Batch.Body: {"data":{"attributes":{"comment":null, {{if index .global.task.input `ReasonForStartingPlan`}} "message":"{{.global.task.input.ReasonForStartingPlan}}"{{else}} "message":"Triggered via Cisco Intersight Orchestrator"{{end}},{{if index .global.task.input `PlanOperation`}} "is-destroy":"{{.global.task.input.PlanOperation}}" {{else}} "is-destroy": false {{end}}},"relationships":{"workspace":{"data":{"type":"workspaces","id":"{{.global.task.input.WorkspaceId}}"}}},"type":"runs"}}
Batch.Name: StartNewTerraformPlan

Outcomes.Message: We are unable to start a plan for the Workspace "{{ .global.task.input.WorkspaceId }}". "{{ .global.StartNewTerraformPlan.output.detail }}." Do try again by uploading a configuration version.
Outcomes.Name: ConfigDoesNotExist

Outcomes.Message: Either the Workspace ID is wrong or has not been provided. Do try again by providing the right Workspace ID.
Outcomes.Name: WorkspaceIdEmpty

Outcomes.Message: We are unable to start a plan for the Workspace "{{ .global.task.input.WorkspaceId }}" due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{ .global.StartNewTerraformPlan.output.HttpStatusMsg }}."
Outcomes.Name: AnyOtherFailure

Outcomes.Message: Started new plan for the Workspace "{{ .global.task.input.WorkspaceId }}".
Outcomes.Name: ConfigUploaded

Body.Description: API Task to start a new plan
Body.Name: StartNewTerraformPlan

Outcomes.Message: We are unable to fetch the Run ID due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{.global.GetTerraformConfirmedRunId.output.HttpStatusMsg}}."
We are unable to fetch the Run ID. Do try again after ensuring that the Run is in one of "Planned" / "Cost Estimated" / "Policy Checked" state.
The Run ID "{{index .global.GetTerraformConfirmedRunId.output.RunId 0}}" is in use.

Body.Description: API Task to fetch workspace Id
Body.Name: GetTerraformConfirmedRunId

Outcomes.Message: We are unable to fetch the latest Run ID due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{.global.GetTerraformLatestRunId.output.HttpStatusMsg}}."
We are unable to fetch a Run ID. Do retry by uploading a configuration version.
The Run ID "{{.global.GetTerraformLatestRunId.output.RunId}}" is in use

Body.Description: API Task to fetch workspace Id
Body.Name: GetTerraformLatestRunId

Outcomes.Message: We could not confirm the Run ID "{{.global.task.input.RunId | TrimSpace}}" for this workspace. Do try again by providing a Run ID that is in one of "Planned" / "Cost Estimated" / "Policy Checked" state.
Outcomes.Name: RunIdDoesNotHaveIsConfirmableTrue

Outcomes.Message: The Run ID "{{.global.task.input.RunId | TrimSpace}}" is invalid. Do try again by providing the correct Run ID.
Outcomes.Name: RunIdDoesNotExist

Outcomes.Message: We are unable to confirm the run due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{ .global.ConfirmTerraformRun.output.HttpStatusMsg }}."
Outcomes.Name: AnyOtherFailure

Outcomes.Message: The Run ID "{{.global.task.input.RunId | TrimSpace}}" is confirmed and will be applied.
Outcomes.Name: ConfirmRunSubmitted

Body.Description: API Task to confirm the run and execute terrafom apply
Body.Name: ConfirmTerraformRun

Outcomes.Message: This Run ID "{{ .global.task.input.RunId }}" does not exist. Do try again by providing the right Run ID.
The Run ID "{{ .global.task.input.RunId }}" is in "{{.global.GetTerraformRunFinalState.output.RunState}}" state.
The Run ID "{{ .global.task.input.RunId }}" is being processed and is in "{{.global.GetTerraformRunFinalState.output.RunState}}" state.
The Run ID "{{ .global.task.input.RunId }}" is being processed and is in "{{.global.GetTerraformRunFinalState.output.RunState}}" state.
The Run ID "{{ .global.task.input.RunId }}" is in "{{.global.GetTerraformRunFinalState.output.RunState}}" state.
We are unable to retrieve the state due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{.global.GetTerraformRunFinalState.output.HttpStatusMsg}}."
We are unable to retrieve the state due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{.global.GetTerraformRunFinalState.output.RunState}}".
Outcomes.Name: FailureState

Body.Description: Generic Batch API Task
Body.Name: GetTerraformRunFinalState

Outcomes.Message: Either the Workspace ID "{{.global.task.input.WorkspaceId}}" does not exist or it does not have any states saved. Do try again by providing a valid Workspace ID with saved states.
We are unable to fetch the current state version due to an unexpected error. Do try again. "{{.global.GetTerraformCurrentStateVersion.output.HttpStatusMsg}}."
We fetched the current state version for this Workspace "{{.global.task.input.WorkspaceId}}".

Body.Description: API Task to fetch current state version of a workspace
Body.Name: GetTerraformCurrentStateVersion

Body.Description: Generic Batch API Task
Body.Name: GenericBatchApiTask

Batch.Description: Invokes the given Web API against the given endpoint. The endpoint can be Intersight API or an external endpoint added as Target in Intersight. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked.
Batch.Label: Invoke Web API Request
